place.name: SHOTESHAM ST MARY
place.gazetteerText: SHOTTESHAM-ST. MARY, or Low Shottesham, a parish in Henstead district, Norfolk; 1¾ mile SE of Swainsthorpe r. station. Post town, Shottesham, under Norwich. Acres, 1,910. Rated property, £3,055. Pop., 369. Houses, 76. The manor, with S. Park, belongs to R. Fellowes, Esq. The parish comprises the three quondam parishes of S.-St. Mary, S.-St. Martin, and S.-St. Botolph. The living is annexed to that of S.-All Saints. The churches of St. M. and St. B. have long been in ruins; but that of St. M. is still good. Charities, £6. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
